message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO. 

This paper deals with the problem of multi-person pose estimation in images and videos, which is a well-known computer vision task. The paper proposes a novel approach to refine the pose estimates obtained from existing methods, which involves training a neural network to predict a refined pose given the input image and the initial pose estimate. This approach involves both computer vision and machine learning techniques, which are typically covered in the arXiv sub-categories cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper introduces a novel data augmentation scheme for training the network, which involves modeling "hard" human pose cases. This aspect of the paper could potentially be relevant to the arXiv sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.MM (Multimedia), which deal with topics such as data augmentation, modeling, and multimedia analysis. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach on several popular pose estimation benchmarks, which could be relevant to the arXiv sub-category cs.RO (Robotics), which deals with topics such as perception, control, and navigation in robotics.
